register.description: The Revision Register contains the major and minor revisions for the module.

bitfield.description: Business Unit: 10 = Processors
Module ID
RTL revision. Will vary depending on release.
Major revision
Minor revision

register.description: The Info Register gives the configuration Inforrmation of this VIM.

bitfield.description: Total number of Interrupts

register.description: The Prioritized IRQ Register shows the number of the highest priority pending IRQ.

bitfield.description: Indicates that the num field is valid. 0h = num field is invalid. 1h = num field is valid.
Priority of the highest priority pending IRQ. valid only if the valid flag is set.
Number of the highest priority pending IRQ. valid only if the valid flag is set.

register.description: The Prioritized FIQ Register shows the number of the highest priority pending FIQ.

bitfield.description: Indicates that the num field is valid. 0h = num field is invalid. 1h = num field is valid.
Priority of the highest priority pending FIQ. valid only if the valid flag is set.
Number of the highest priority pending FIQ. valid only if the valid flag is set.

register.description: The IRQ Group Status Register indicates which groups have pending IRQ interrupts.

bitfield.description: Indicates that the num field is valid.

register.description: The FIQ Group Status Register indicates which groups have pending FIQ interrupts.

bitfield.description: Indicates that the num field is valid.

register.description: The IRQ Vector Address Register contains the 32-bit address of the interrupt vector for the current pendind IRQ.

bitfield.description: Upper 30 bits of the 32-bit vector address. Only valid if the Prioritized IRQ Register valid flag is true.

register.description: The FIQ Vector Address Register contains the 32-bit address of the interrupt vector for the current pendind FIQ.

bitfield.description: Upper 30 bits of the 32-bit vector address. Only valid if the Prioritized FIQ Register valid flag is true.

register.description: The Active IRQ Register shows the number of the currently active IRQ.

bitfield.description: Indicates that the num field is valid. Set when the IRQ Vector Address Register is read and cleared whenever the IRQ Vector Address Register is written. 0h = num field is invalid. 1h = num field is valid.
Priority of the highest priority pending IRQ. valid only if the valid flag is set.
Number of the currently active IRQ. Loaded from teh Prioritized IRQ Register whenever the IRQ Vector Address is read. Valid only if the valid flag is set.

register.description: The Active FIQ Register shows the number of the currently active FIQ.

bitfield.description: Indicates that the num field is valid. Set when the FIQ Vector Address Register is read and cleared whenever the FIQ Vector Address Register is written. 0h = num field is invalid. 1h = num field is valid.
Priority of the highest priority pending IRQ. valid only if the valid flag is set.
Number of the currently active FIQ. Loaded from teh Prioritized FIQ Register whenever the FIQ Vector Address is read. Valid only if the valid flag is set.

register.description: The DED Vector Address contains a default vector address for when an uncorrectable error is detected for an active IRQ or FIQ.

bitfield.description: Upper 30 bits of the 32-bit vector address.

register.description: Raw Status/Set Register for Group A Errors Offset = 400h + (j * 20h); where j = 0h to Fh

bitfield.description: This is the raw status/set for interrupts Group A

register.description: Masked Status and Clear Register Offset = 404h + (j * 20h); where j = 0h to Fh

bitfield.description: This is the masked status/clear for interrupts in Group A

register.description: Enable Set Register Offset = 408h + (j * 20h); where j = 0h to Fh

bitfield.description: This is the mask enable set for interrupts in Group A

register.description: Interrupt Enabled Clear register Offset = 40Ch + (j * 20h); where j = 0h to Fh

bitfield.description: This is the mask enable clear for interrupts in Group A

register.description: Masked IRQ Status and Clear Register Offset = 410h + (j * 20h); where j = 0h to Fh

bitfield.description: This is the masked status/clear for interrupts in Group A mapped as IRQs

register.description: Masked FIQ Status and Clear Register Offset = 414h + (j * 20h); where j = 0h to Fh

bitfield.description: This is the masked status/clear for interrupts in Group A mapped as FIQs

register.description: Maps interrupts to IRQ or FIQ Offset = 418h + (j * 20h); where j = 0h to Fh

bitfield.description: This is interrupt map for interrupts in Group A. 0 - IRQ 1 - FIQ

register.description: Indicates whether an interrupt is a pulse or level source Offset = 41Ch + (j * 20h); where j = 0h to Fh

bitfield.description: This is interrupt type for interrupts in Group A. 0 - Level 1 - Pulse

register.description: This register contains the priority for Interrupt A Offset = 1000h + (j * 4h); where j = 0h to 1FFh

bitfield.description: This is the priority for interrupt A. 0 - Highest ... 15 - Lowest (Default)

register.description: This register contains the vector for Interrupt A Offset = 2000h + (j * 4h); where j = 0h to 1FFh

bitfield.description: This is the upper 30 bits of the 32-bits vector for interrupt A.
